snippet: The chances for a comprehensive permanent accord that would limit the country’s nuclear program must be kept alive.
abstract: Editorial contends it would be tragedy if momentum for comprehensive permanent agreement with Iran over its nuclear program is not kept alive; warns that any deal that can be accepted must be structured so that Iran cannot one day build a nuclear weapon without warning; calls on leaders of world powers to follow Pres Obama's example and to nudge Ayatollah Ali Khamenei toward a nuclear deal.
lead_paragraph: The chances for a comprehensive permanent accord that would limit the country’s nuclear program must be kept alive.

headline.main: A Final Dash on an Iran Deal
headline.print_headline: A Final Dash on an Iran Deal
